items.title: Uncaught RemoteDisconnected Exception
items.body:
We've got an application that uploads files to the GCS API, in our code we're catching a bunch of Google Cloud exceptions, however we're still seeing some failures.  It looks as though this library isn't catching exceptions coming from httplib2 and reraising them as Google Cloud exceptions.

A try except around the request [here](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/google-auth-library-python-httplib2/blob/master/google_auth_httplib2.py#L197) catching the base HTTP exception [here](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/3.6/Lib/http/client.py#L1411) seems like the best way to fix this?

//edit - Adding stacktrace.

```
RemoteDisconnected: Remote end closed connection without response
  File "fbq/main.py", line 255, in run_manage_file
    return self.manage_file(filename)
  File "fbq/main.py", line 270, in manage_file
    self.push_to_gcs(zipped_file)
  File "fbq/main.py", line 153, in push_to_gcs
    gcs_blob.upload_from_filename(file_name, content_type='application/gzip')
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_storage-1.0.0-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/storage/blob.py", line 671, in upload_from_filename
    file_obj, content_type=content_type, client=client)
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_storage-1.0.0-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/storage/blob.py", line 622, in upload_from_file
    http_response = upload.stream_file(use_chunks=True)
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_core-0.24.1-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/streaming/transfer.py", line 1094, in stream_file
    response = send_func(self.stream.tell())
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_core-0.24.1-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/streaming/transfer.py", line 1223, in _send_chunk
    return self._send_media_request(request, end)
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_core-0.24.1-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/streaming/transfer.py", line 1133, in _send_media_request
    self.bytes_http, request, retries=self.num_retries)
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_core-0.24.1-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/streaming/http_wrapper.py", line 384, in make_api_request
    redirections=redirections)
  File "opt/fbq-virtualenv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/google_cloud_core-0.24.1-py3.6.egg/google/cloud/streaming/http_wrapper.py", line 347, in _make_api_request_no_retry
    redirections=redirections, connection_type=connection_type)
  File "google_auth_httplib2-0.0.2-py3.6.egg/google_auth_httplib2.py", line 198, in request
    uri, method, body=body, headers=request_headers, **kwargs)
  File "httplib2/__init__.py", line 1322, in request
    (response, content) = self._request(conn, authority, uri, request_uri, method, body, headers, redirections, cachekey)
  File "httplib2/__init__.py", line 1072, in _request
    (response, content) = self._conn_request(conn, request_uri, method, body, headers)
  File "httplib2/__init__.py", line 1025, in _conn_request
    response = conn.getresponse()
  File "raven/breadcrumbs.py", line 353, in getresponse
    rv = real_getresponse(self, *args, **kwargs)
  File "http/client.py", line 1331, in getresponse
    response.begin()
  File "http/client.py", line 297, in begin
    version, status, reason = self._read_status()
  File "http/client.py", line 266, in _read_status
    raise RemoteDisconnected("Remote end closed connection without"
```

items.title: Update the homepage link on PyPi
items.body:
The homepage link on https://pypi.python.org/pypi/google-auth-httplib2 is currently pointing to https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/google-auth-library-python but I think it should be https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/google-auth-library-python-httplib2. 

Separately, is there a readthedocs.io page for this repo?
For example, for google-auth-oauthlib the link is http://google-auth-oauthlib.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
